page.title: 14OLD WINDSOR LOCK
page.content: On June 28th 1985 we spent a morning at Old Windsor Lock.The lock-keeper and his assistant were busy all morning opening and closing the lock for a stream of boats, rivers cruisers with parties of school children,small boats called Taurus, Lady Pamela, Wye-Kare,Vivacity,carried holiday- makers. The lock-keepers house stands on an island in the middle of the river,locally called Lock Island. A flood tide mark is fixed on the side of the house from the last flood in 1942.The lock gates can be operated by river travellers very early in the morning or late at night.Steps are cut into each side of the lock.It is 179 feet long and 24 feet wide. On the bank was the patrol boat called "Echo" used by the Thames Survey Team to examine the banks and bottom of the Thames for damage. by Sonia and Alex
